Articles.Content:
Just something I was curious about, an answer would be much appreciated!

Say you have an image you want to show but is too large / small for your liking.

Is there a way to resize an image using the [noparse]![%7Boption%7D](%7Boption%7D)[/noparse] tags?

No there's not, at least to my knowledge. If you upload an image to [Imgur](http://imgur.com/) however you do have an 'edit' option you can tick, and you can resize the image there ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's bad form to resize an image using tags anyway. Either you're making it larger than the source and it'll be ugly, or you're making it smaller than the source and forcing someone to download a (much, in many cases) larger file than they think they're getting.

I browse the forums tethered to a cell phone a lot of the time. The propensity of PNGs in posts over JPGs is bad enough, don't make me think I'm looking at a thumbnail that is actually 1080p!
